intro: Leptactina seretii, commonly known as the Seret's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Leptactina seretii is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
